title: C04-1011

sentences.text: We consider the problem of computing the Kullback-Leibler distance , also called the relative entropy , between a probabilistic context-free grammar and a probabilistic finite automaton .
We show that there is a closed-form -LRB- analytical -RRB- solution for one part of the Kullback-Leibler distance , viz the cross-entropy .
We discuss several applications of the result to the problem of distributional approximation of probabilistic context-free grammars by means of probabilistic finite automata .

Entity-result.label: result
Entity-result.description: The 'result' refers to the analytical solution for the cross-entropy component of the Kullback-Leibler distance between probabilistic context-free grammars and probabilistic finite automata, which has several applications in distributional approximation.

Entity-analytical.label: analytical
Entity-analytical.description: In this context, 'analytical' refers to a closed-form mathematical solution for calculating the cross-entropy component of the Kullback-Leibler distance between a probabilistic context-free grammar and a probabilistic finite automaton.

Entity-distributional_approximation.label: distributional approximation
Entity-distributional_approximation.description: Distributional approximation refers to the method of approximating probabilistic context-free grammars using probabilistic finite automata, particularly in the context of computing the Kullback-Leibler distance.

Entity-application.label: applications
Entity-application.description: The term 'applications' refers to the various use cases and implementations of the analytical solution for the Kullback-Leibler distance in the context of approximating probabilistic context-free grammars with probabilistic finite automata.

Entity-application_of_the_result.label: applications of the result
Entity-application_of_the_result.description: The term 'applications of the result' refers to the practical uses of the analytical solution for the Kullback-Leibler distance, specifically in the context of approximating probabilistic context-free grammars using probabilistic finite automata.

Entity-relative_entropy.label: relative entropy
Entity-relative_entropy.description: Relative entropy, also known as Kullback-Leibler divergence, is a statistical measure that quantifies the difference between two probability distributions, often used in information theory to assess how one distribution diverges from a second, expected distribution.

Entity-closed-form.label: closed-form
Entity-closed-form.description: In mathematics, a closed-form solution refers to an explicit expression that can be computed in a finite number of standard operations, such as addition, multiplication, and taking roots, which in this context pertains to the analytical solution for the cross-entropy component of the Kullback-Leibler distance.

Entity-kullback-leibler_distance.label: Kullback-Leibler distance
Entity-kullback-leibler_distance.description: The Kullback-Leibler distance is a statistical measure used in information theory to quantify the difference between two probability distributions.

Entity-probabilistic_context-free_gramma.label: probabilistic context-free grammar
Entity-probabilistic_context-free_gramma.description: A probabilistic context-free grammar is a type of formal grammar that associates probabilities with its production rules, allowing for the generation of strings with varying likelihoods based on a given context-free structure.

Entity-probabilistic_finite_automaton.label: probabilistic finite automaton
Entity-probabilistic_finite_automaton.description: A probabilistic finite automaton is a computational model that extends traditional finite automata by incorporating probabilities into state transitions, allowing it to represent and process stochastic processes.

Entity-cross-entropy.label: cross-entropy
Entity-cross-entropy.description: Cross-entropy is a statistical measure from information theory that quantifies the difference between two probability distributions, often used to evaluate the performance of probabilistic models.

summary: We consider the problem of computing the Kullback-Leibler distance , also called the relative entropy , between a probabilistic context-free grammar and a probabilistic finite automaton . We show that there is a closed-form -LRB- analytical -RRB- solution for one part of the Kullback-Leibler distance , viz the cross-entropy . We discuss several applications of the result to the problem of distributional approximation of probabilistic context-free grammars by means of probabilistic finite automata .

Predicate-also_called.label: also called
Predicate-also_called.description: The predicate 'also called' is used to indicate that the subject has an alternative name or designation, which is represented by the object. This relationship highlights the equivalence or synonymy between the two terms, suggesting that they refer to the same concept or entity in different contexts or terminologies.

Predicate-between.label: between
Predicate-between.description: The predicate 'between' indicates a relationship of positioning or association that connects the subject and object, suggesting that the subject exists in a state or condition that is defined or influenced by the object. It often implies a comparative or relational context where the subject is situated in relation to the object, highlighting a distinction or interaction that occurs within the scope defined by the object.

Predicate-is_called.label: is called
Predicate-is_called.description: The predicate 'is called' serves to establish a naming relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject is referred to by the name or term represented by the object. This predicate is commonly used to denote synonyms, alternative names, or designations that are used to identify the subject in various contexts.

Predicate-are_approximated_by.label: are approximated by
Predicate-are_approximated_by.description: The predicate 'are approximated by' indicates a relationship where the subject is represented or modeled in a way that is close to or similar to the object, suggesting that the object serves as a simplified or alternative representation of the subject. This relationship often implies that the object captures essential characteristics or behaviors of the subject, albeit with some level of abstraction or reduction in complexity.

Predicate-has.label: has
Predicate-has.description: The predicate 'has' indicates a possessive relationship between the subject and the object, signifying that the subject contains, includes, or is characterized by the object. It establishes a connection where the subject is seen as the holder or owner of the object, which represents a specific attribute, feature, or component associated with the subject.

Predicate-is_related_to.label: is related to
Predicate-is_related_to.description: The predicate 'is related to' indicates a connection or association between the subject and the object, suggesting that they share a common context, concept, or characteristic. This relationship can imply various forms of linkage, such as similarity, dependency, or relevance, and is often used to highlight how two entities influence or inform each other within a particular domain.

Predicate-has_a_solution_for.label: has a solution for
Predicate-has_a_solution_for.description: The predicate 'has a solution for' indicates that the subject provides a method, approach, or answer that effectively addresses or resolves the problem or concept represented by the object. It establishes a relationship where the subject is capable of offering a viable means to understand, calculate, or implement the object in question.

Predicate-involves.label: involves
Predicate-involves.description: The predicate 'involves' indicates a relationship where the subject is engaged in or requires the object as a necessary component or aspect of its definition, function, or process. It suggests that the subject cannot be fully understood or realized without considering the object, highlighting a connection where the object plays a crucial role in the context of the subject.

Predicate-applies_to.label: applies to
Predicate-applies_to.description: The predicate 'applies to' establishes a relationship where the subject is relevant or pertinent to the object, indicating that the subject is an instance, case, or example that is governed by or can be associated with the characteristics, rules, or principles represented by the object.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates a hierarchical relationship where the subject represents a specific instance or category that falls under a more general or inclusive category represented by the object. This relationship signifies that the object encompasses a wider scope or range of concepts than the subject, thereby establishing a connection where the subject is a subset of the object.
